transcript.title: Ministerial Arrangements
transcript.content:
10 September 1971

I should like to inform the House of the following Ministerial arrangements.

Mr. Holten, in addition to his duties as Minister for Repatriation, will assist the Minister for Trade and Industry.

I have also made the following appointments of Assistant Ministers:

  • The Prime Minister will be assisted by Mr. Dobie 
  • The Minister for Primary Industry will be assisted by Mr. King
  • The Minister for Health and Leader of the Government in the Senate will be assisted by Senator Marriott;
  • The Postmaster-General will be assisted by Mr. Robinson;
  • The Minister for Labour and National Service will be assisted by Mr. Street; and
  • The Minister for Civil Aviation will be assisted by Mr. McLeay.

Senator Marriott will take up his duties after he has been sworn as a member of the Executive Council. This will also apply to Mr. King on his return from overseas.
